  "description": "United Nigeria Airlines is a wholly owned Nigerian company incorporated under the Companies and Allied Matters Act of 1990 at the Corporate Affairs Commission to offer commercial air transportation services under the trade name United Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location:&nbsp;Enugu
Employment Type: Full time
Department: Finance&nbsp;&amp;&nbsp;Accounts
Reports to: Senior Internal Auditor

Job Summary


	The Internal Auditor shall support the Senior Internal Auditor in performing financial, operational, compliance, and special audits (such as investigations, reported fraud cases, etc) on the organization&rsquo;s businesses to identify risks and controls that may have an impact on the integrity of reported financial information or the achievement of business goals and objectives.
	Also responsible for analyzing and examining the organization&rsquo;s books and records of accounts to ensure and ascertain that they are being recorded in strict compliance with the government and other regulators&rsquo; rules and regulations.


Duties / Responsiblities


	Responsible for documenting audit procedures following the department&rsquo;s audit method
	Perform risk assessment of the assigned department or functional area within the required time&nbsp; frame
	Responsible for establishing risk-based audit programs
	Collaborate with the Head of Internal Audit to determine the scope of review
	Carry out an appraisal to determine the suitability of the internal control design
	Perform audit testing on specified areas to identify issues and report dimensions of risk
	Responsible for maintaining electronic work papers (using data analytics) and evidence to support findings and recommendations
	Responsible for communicating audit findings and suggestions to all levels of management
	Provide quality audit reports with succinct, practical, and workable suggestions that reflect the context in which the business operates
	Advance on the existing internal audit methods and programs to tackle all the key business risks


Experience &amp; Qualifications


	A minimum of a Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Administration
	A minimum of three (3) years industry-relevant and hands-on experience
	3 years of work experience in a finance or internal audit department of a global audit firm (such as the Big 4)
	Advanced certifications such as ACA (ICAN), ACCA, CIA, CPA, M.Sc., MBA
	Advanced knowledge of internal controls across the various business cycles (e.g., finance reporting, audit reporting, etc
	Previous experience in the Aviation industry is an added advantage


Required Skills:


	Proficient in Microsoft Office Programs (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access)
	Knowledge of SAP and Data Analytics software, including ACL or IDEA, is an added advantage
	Excellent Communication skills, both written and verbal, towards all stakeholders
	A very robust and good interpersonal skills to develop relationships, interact with teams, and promote open communication among teams
	A creative thinker, innovative, and problem-solving skills, with robust risk awareness and thorough understanding of processes, policies, and procedures, and of course, the control process
	Ability to identify problems and prioritize situations that require urgent attention


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and cover letter detailing their relevant experience, Location and qualifications&nbsp;to:&nbsp;careers@flyunitednigeria.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.",

Internal Auditor Job at United Nigeria Airlines




        
    

        
        United Nigeria Airlines is a wholly owned Nigerian company incorporated under the Companies and Allied Matters Act of 1990 at the Corporate Affairs Commission to offer commercial air transportation services under the trade name United Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Auditor

Job Location: Enugu
Employment Type: Full time
Department: Finance & Accounts
Reports to: Senior Internal Auditor

Job Summary
     

            
    




	The Internal Auditor shall support the Senior Internal Auditor in performing financial, operational, compliance, and special audits (such as investigations, reported fraud cases, etc) on the organization’s businesses to identify risks and controls that may have an impact on the integrity of reported financial information or the achievement of business goals and objectives.
	Also responsible for analyzing and examining the organization’s books and records of accounts to ensure and ascertain that they are being recorded in strict compliance with the government and other regulators’ rules and regulations.


Duties / Responsiblities


	Responsible for documenting audit procedures following the department’s audit method
	Perform risk assessment of the assigned department or functional area within the required time  frame
	Responsible for establishing risk-based audit programs
	Collaborate with the Head of Internal Audit to determine the scope of review
	Carry out an appraisal to determine the suitability of the internal control design
	Perform audit testing on specified areas to identify issues and report dimensions of risk
	Responsible for maintaining electronic work papers (using data analytics) and evidence to support findings and recommendations
	Responsible for communicating audit findings and suggestions to all levels of management
	Provide quality audit reports with succinct, practical, and workable suggestions that reflect the context in which the business operates
	Advance on the existing internal audit methods and programs to tackle all the key business risks


Experience & Qualifications


	A minimum of a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or Business Administration
	A minimum of three (3) years industry-relevant and hands-on experience
	3 years of work experience in a finance or internal audit department of a global audit firm (such as the Big 4)
	Advanced certifications such as ACA (ICAN), ACCA, CIA, CPA, M.Sc., MBA
	Advanced knowledge of internal controls across the various business cycles (e.g., finance reporting, audit reporting, etc
	Previous experience in the Aviation industry is an added advantage


Required Skills:


	Proficient in Microsoft Office Programs (Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Access)
	Knowledge of SAP and Data Analytics software, including ACL or IDEA, is an added advantage
	Excellent Communication skills, both written and verbal, towards all stakeholders
	A very robust and good interpersonal skills to develop relationships, interact with teams, and promote open communication among teams
	A creative thinker, innovative, and problem-solving skills, with robust risk awareness and thorough understanding of processes, policies, and procedures, and of course, the control process
	Ability to identify problems and prioritize situations that require urgent attention


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their Resume and cover letter detailing their relevant experience, Location and qualifications to: careers@flyunitednigeria.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

Insurance Underwriter Job at Ronsberger Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Ronsberger Nigeria Limited is a reputable Healthcare services group, involved in the management of hospitals, clinics, community health plan, health management organization (HMO) and provision of capacity building to the health care sector at the national level.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Insurance Underwriter

Job Location: Garki, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Detail


	We are currently seeking dynamic and qualified person(s) to fill the position of Business Support Officer (Underwriter) at our Head Office, Abuja


Job Duties/Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Underwriting existing policies for profitability and continuity purposes.
	Creates Policy wording and document in line with NHIS stipulations for each client.
	Approves new client for Health Insurance after considerable risk assessment.
	Development of new product in line with NHIS guidelines.
	Gathering information from clients, assessing their insurance needs and risk profile.
	Drafting of Contract papers for prospective Healthcare providers as deemed fit.
	Carry out Actuarial calculations as the need may arise.


Requirements
A successful candidate must have:


	Candidates should possess a Bachelor's Degree or HND in Insurance, Actuarial Science or related fields with 3-5 years of experience.
	At least Post NYSC experience should be 5 years minimum.
	Professional Certificate in CIIN
	Work experience with an HMO will be an advantage


Skills and Abilities:
Qualified candidates must have:


	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Organizational and managerial skills.
	Knowledge of computer operations.
	Efficient customer relations and retention skills.
	Ability to take initiative with strong analytical and problem solving skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: Anthony.ugwu@ronsbergerhmo.com using the Job Postion as the subject of the email.

Business Support Officer Job at Ronsberger Nigeria Limited




        
    

        
        Ronsberger Nigeria Limited - We are reputable Healthcare services group, involved in the management of hospitals, clinics, community health plan, health management organization (HMO) and provision of capacity building to the health care sector at the national level. We are a foremost Health Maintenance Organization (HMO) in Nigeria that is accredited and regulated by the National Health Insurance Scheme (NHIS).

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Support Officer

Job Location: Garki, Abuja (FCT)
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

            
    




	Our Company is looking for dynamic person(s) to fill the position of Business Support Officer (Underwriter) at our Head Office, Abuja


Job Duties / Responsibilities


	Identify prospective clients both Corporate/individual groups and take steps to provide their needs profitably.
	Review Company’s product/services by carrying out marketing research of the Company’s product to determine the competitive nature of the products in the market.
	Develop rapport with the existing clientele and provide support that will continually improve the relationship.
	Grow and retain existing accounts by presenting new solutions/services to the potential clients.
	Maintain detailed information about Clients in the network.
	Gathering information from clients, assessing their insurance needs and risk profile.
	Drafting of Contract papers for prospective Healthcare providers as deemed fit.
	Carry out Actuarial calculations as the need may arise.


Qualifications/ Requirements
A successful candidate must have:


	A Bachelor`s Degree or HND in Business Admin. or other related fields.
	At least Post NYSC experience should be 3 years of minimum.
	Work experience with an HMO will be an advantage


Skills / Abilities:
Qualified candidates must have:


	Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
	Organizational and managerial skills.
	Knowledge of computer operations.
	Efficient customer relations and retention skills.
	Ability to take initiative with strong analytical and problem solving skills.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: Anthony.ugwu@ronsbergerhmo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
